alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 11:31AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding from excessive runoff from the rainfall this morning continues. * WHERE...Portions of New Orleans. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including ponding of water in urban locales. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell this morning due to thunderstorms. - The locally heavy rain threat has shifted south of the area before midday. However, overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding to persist in the advisory area through early this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The city of New Orleans, East New Orleans and Lakefront Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
